title: Food Recipes Website with Internet Identity Login and User-Submitted Recipe Sharing

requirements.text: Implement authentication using Internet Identity so users can sign in and sign out, and the UI reflects the current auth state (signed out vs signed in).

quotes: Aslo add the function of login

acceptanceCriteria: A signed-out user can initiate Internet Identity login and becomes signed in after completing it.
A signed-in user can sign out and returns to the signed-out state.
The frontend displays the signed-in user's identifier (e.g., Principal) or a clear 'Signed in' indicator.
Backend methods that modify user-owned data reject anonymous callers (not authenticated).

requirements.text: Create a public recipes experience where any visitor can browse a list of published recipes and open a recipe detail page that shows full recipe content.

quotes: Create  an website for food recipes

acceptanceCriteria: The home/browse view loads and displays a list of published recipes from the backend.
Selecting a recipe opens a detail view that shows at minimum: title, description, ingredients, and steps.
Unauthenticated users can browse and view published recipes without logging in.
If there are no recipes yet, the UI shows an empty state message in English (e.g., 'No recipes yet').

requirements.text: Allow authenticated users to create and publish their own recipes via a 'New Recipe' form, and ensure that only the recipe owner can edit or delete their own recipes.

quotes: sharing their own recipes by users

acceptanceCriteria: A signed-in user can open a 'New Recipe' form and submit a recipe successfully.
Newly published recipes appear in the public browse list and are viewable by others.
A signed-in user can edit and delete only recipes they created; attempts to edit/delete others' recipes are blocked in the UI and rejected by the backend.
The 'New Recipe' and edit actions are not available to signed-out users (or they are prompted to sign in).

requirements.text: Persist recipe data in the Motoko canister so that recipes remain available after page refresh and canister upgrades (using stable storage patterns).

quotes: Create  an website for food recipes

acceptanceCriteria: After creating recipes, refreshing the browser still shows the same recipes.
State is stored in a stable structure suitable for upgrades (no loss of recipes when upgrading the canister in development workflow).

requirements.text: Create a coherent, distinct visual theme and apply it consistently across the site (typography, colors, spacing, and components) suitable for a food/recipe app; avoid a blue/purple primary palette.

quotes: Create  an website for food recipes

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent layout, spacing, and component styling.
Primary UI colors are not blue/purple-dominant.
User-facing text is in English across navigation, buttons, empty states, and form labels.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets to support the UI theme and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.

quotes: Create  an website for food recipes

acceptanceCriteria: The generated images listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
At least the logo is visible in the app header/navigation and the hero/banner image is visible on the home page.
Images are served as static frontend assets (not fetched from the backend).

constraints: Use Internet Identity as the only authentication method.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files in frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose them instead.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Real-time chat, comments, likes, or notifications.

required: Warm minimal 'recipe book + spoon' logo in flat vector style (recipe-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Soft textured hero banner with food-themed abstract shapes (recipe-hero.dim_1600x600.png)
Set of 6 minimal monochrome food icons (plate, chef hat, whisk, bowl, leaf, timer) on transparent background (food-icons-set.dim_1024x1024.png)
